sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the long-term storage of samples and reagents at very low temperatures.
sections.scope: Applicable to storage activities in Pharmaceutical Analysis.
procedure: Verify that the freezer is set to the required temperature (e.g., -20°C or -80°C).
Ensure samples are stored in compatible, clearly labeled containers.
Organize the samples in racks to allow for efficient retrieval and airflow.
Monitor and record the temperature on a daily log sheet.
Minimize the duration and frequency of door openings.
Check the door seal for frost build-up and defrost manually if required.
Clean the interior periodically with an appropriate disinfectant.
Document any temperature excursions and corrective actions.
precautions: Never store food or beverages in the laboratory deep freezer.
Ensure a backup power supply is available for critical samples.
Wear insulated gloves when handling items inside the freezer.
Do not overload the freezer, as it affects cooling efficiency.
Keep a detailed inventory of stored materials.
